title: WCAS SOCIOL 476-0-23 Topics in Sociological Analysis

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The United States leads the world in the reliance on the mass imprisonment and solitary confinement of its citizens as an institutionalized mechanism of crime and social control. This course will consider the causes of mass incarceration and its consequences in America. Topics considered will include relationships between welfare support and imprisonment, the rise and fall of punishment regimes, the connection between total incapacitation and solitary confinement, the impact of mass incarceration on inmates and families, links between intensive policing and imprisonment, and the politics of inmate reentry and reform in American society.
